title: fix: do not auto redirect to tls scheme
body:
This patch fix the problem that the client will
auto redirect to tls scheme even setting non-tls broker url which may confuse the user.

title: feat: Change send to not block on waiting receipt
body:
This is a follow up of https://github.com/streamnative/pulsar-rs/pull/297.

I figured it's probably better to reuse the `SendFuture` for async send, since the batch send already delays the resolve of `SendFuture`.

title: fix: multiple clippy warnings
body: [feature is misspelled as features](https://github.com/streamnative/pulsar-rs/pull/296/commits/4e034a80c42202aa51f7782b4ae6cd0c3b1a67a1) - this is a bug.

title: docs: Add history and About section
body: cc @geomagilles @BewareMyPower @stearnsc @Geal

title: chore: Implement Sync for Consumer
fix ordering key assignment issue
body: fix key assignment issue

title: build: disable oldtime feature of chrono
body: `chrono` enables the `oldtime` feature for backwards compatibility but this project doesn't make use of it. Disabling it avoids the dependency on `time` v0.1

title: build: allow to use rustls instead of native-tls
body:
* This is used in an effort to remove all dependencies to openssl.
  Which could be interesting in embedded system or on environment
  which is difficult to know on which openssl version the software
  will run it and breaks deployments.
* It introduces two compiler feature flags which are `tokio-rustls-runtime`
  and `async-std-rustls-runtime` that have the same meaning as
  `tokio-runtime` and `async-std-runtime` except that they use rustls.
* There is a safe guard, if we enable both runtimes, this is the
  native-tls ones that are used to keep consistent with the current
  behaviour.

title: Update license field following SPDX 2.1 license expression standard
body: The new recommendation is to follow the SPDX 2.1 standard. This allows automatic license verification software to work properly. Reference: https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-license-and-license-file-fields

title: fix: dead letter policy for batched messages
body:
Fixes `// TODO: Dead letter policy for batched messages` in `engine.rs`.

Probably not the most performant implementation right now since it collects all payloads into a single Vec instead of iterating over it, but it seems to get the job done for now.

Closes #174

title: feat: use package version for connect client version
ci: simplify protoc dep and update pulsar test broker versions
body: This follows up #272. I test locally and it seems build from source doesn't take too much time.

title: Remove un-subscription when closing consumer
body:
Remove 'unsubscribe' from `consumer.close()`

https://github.com/streamnative/pulsar-rs/issues/279

title: feat: Add function to get the schema from a topic
body: This PR adds the option to query the schema using the consumer

title: Add feature to compile protobuf library from source
body: This is useful for cross compilation.

title: Fix ConsumerEngine::reconnect loop
body:
This patch is to fix #263.

The first commit contains the main fix, which should be sufficient to reconnect a consumer correctly. The two fixes are, as discussed in the issue :
- ignore the drop of the old message source
- send the flow message over the new connection

The following commits aim to clean up some related parts of the connection and reconnection code, to make it clearer and hopefully less error-prone.

title: Soft treshhold for the max batch size in bytes
body:
If this threshold is reached before batch size the batch is considered full and sent.
A soft threshold means there is no performance penalty with this implementation

#268

title: Use atomic long to gen producer/consumer ids and simplify debugging
body:
Fixes: #265 

The issue has all of the context. The general idea is to improve debugging given that Java is mapping an unsigned long to a signed long and then logging that value.

I am still learning rust, so if any of my usage is incorrect, please correct it!

title: Fix: Examples not producing output on consumer side
body:
I didn't have any output on the consumer side by running the example out of the box.

This PR improves that.

title: Add important documents notes related to delays and shedule message configs.
Add support for on-the-fly AuthChallenge
body:
This PR Adds support for on-the-fly auth by handling the `AuthChallengeRequest` command.

Currently receiving `AuthChallengeRequest` logs an error and drops the command; this behaviour can lead to the client becoming disconnected. Instead, the client should authenticate with the Auth provider again and send an `AuthChallengeResponse` command containing the new `auth_data`, which will keep the connection alive.

title: Make `Consumer::seek` future `Send`
body: Currently, the future is not `Send`  because a non-`Send` type is held across the `.await` point. In this case, a mutable reference to `MultiTopicConsumer`. Cloning the config object before building the future solves the issue.

title: Add the ability to `ack`, `nack` and `cumulative_ack` by message ID.
body:
This PR adds the ability to `ack`, `nack` and `cumulative_ack` by message ID and topic name.

This is done because in some situations (like the one we have in Quickwit) we don't want to keep the original messages around or can't in some cases, instead using only the required metadata of the topic name and message-id data.

title: fix: use runtime agnostic stream
body: Signed-off-by: tison <wander4096@gmail.com>
